Recipe.title: Lehi Rice
Recipe.Source: Adapted from the World-Wide Ward Cookbook
Recipe.Description: While thumbing through the World-Wide Ward Cookbook we saw a recipe for a Rice side dish that sounded pretty good. We tried it and the kids went ga-ga. And it is really easy. It is just the basic recipe for Rice, with a few extra ingredients tossed in at the start. So, when we do Rice as a side dish, this is the one we almost always do.

section.instruction: Cut the Celery into thin slices.
In a saucepan with a lid, combine all ingredients.
Reduce heat to medium low and let simmer for about 25 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir, and fluff up.

Notes.note: At the start, it looks like way too much vegetables for the Rice, but once it cooks, and you stir it up, it ends up being just right.
The lid needs to stay in place to keep heat and moisture mostly contained.
The slower the Rice simmers, the better. If you do it too hot, the Rice at the bottom will burn.
Do not stir Rice while it is cooking.

Modifications.modification: You can create the Double-Strength Chicken Broth by using 2 Cups Water + 4 Chicken Bouillon Cubes (or the equivalent).
You can substitute 1 Tablespoon of Butter for the Vegetable Oil.

If you have a Rice Cooker, replace Steps 3-6 with:
Throw everything in Rice Cooker and turn it on.
When it says it is done, stir and fluff up.
